isis.stitle: TSI 98-04-02R - Elimination of Key and Keyway in Air Compressor Drive Gear for Bendix Tu-Flo 550 and 750 Air Compressors

subjectgroup.subject: Elimination of Key and Keyway in Air Compressor Drive Gear for Bendix Tu-Flo 550 and 750 Air Compressors

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to all models with International DT 466/DT 466E and 530/530E engines built after March 1, 1998.

Bendix has implemented changes to the Tu-Flo 550 and 750 air compressor drive gear and crankshaft. The key and keyway have been eliminated in air compressor drive gear and crankshaft. The drive gear retainer nut, tightened to 110 ft-lbs. (149 Nm) of torque, is sufficient to prevent the gear from turning on the shaft and eliminates the need for the key and keyway.

caution.para: Do not mix non-keyed components with old material (keyed components). Mixing of non-keyed components with keyed components may fail the crankshaft.

geninfo.para: Effective with Engine Serial Number 1050304 for the Bendix 550, and Engine Serial Number 1055789 for the Bendix 750, Tu-Flo compressors have the new style forged crankshaft. The drive gear retainer nut should be tightened to 110 ft-lbs. (149 Nm).

caution.para: Do not use an air impact tool to tighten the drive gear retainer nut to prevent possible damage to the crankshaft.
Using a Bendix Tu-Flo 750 compressor with a DT 466 rated at 2400 RPM will result in compressor failure. The Bendix Tu-Flo 750 compressor is rated for a maximum of 2000 RPM.
